name: Disney's Polynesian Resort

reviews.text: We stayed here to give another Disney resort a try following a bad experience with the Contemporary. All I can say is that it will be hard to stay anywhere else when we come back in 2014. First of all, the lobby smells amazing. The staff could NOT have been more accomdating. Yes, the rooms might be a little Brady Bunch goes to Hawaii, for the price but we're park people. We are at Disney to see Mickey and ride all the rides. I want to stay where we can get to the park and stay in the park as long as possible. Our rooms were clean, comfortable, and exactly fit our needs. We loved it.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.text: The commitment to the Disney ideals was so evident at Polynesian that they even owned and righted issues that occured within the park for us without the blink of an eye. First class people, first class experience.
reviews.title: A Disney Virgin

reviews.text: The overall experience was fantastic. The room was clean and spacious and the staff very accommodating. Even with the renovation to the beach we enjoyed the stay and were not turned off by the trucks and equipment going back and forth past our window.
reviews.title: Great location and perks

reviews.text: The only thing that I was disappointed with was the reservation for dinner. We called ahead as recommended and had a 7:15 reservation. When we arrived @ 7pm we were told that there was a waiting period and we would be called as soon as a table was available. An hour later we inquired again and were told that even tho we had reservations they sit guests as people arrive and as close to reservation as possible.
reviews.title: Disney girls weekend

reviews.text: So we asked for the manager, when she saw that we were with a young child that had obviously been through chemotherapy ( hair loss) she scrambled and found a table for us immediately. ( there were several tables available,just not cleared) After that our service was fast, we were seated and served faster then the table next to us who had obviously been sitting for sometime waiting for service.
reviews.title: Beautiful!

reviews.text: This was our second time staying at the Polynesian and our stay was so much nicer this time around. The staff was super accommodating from the time we arrived until our departure. We did our research and found that finding the building that fits your needs is key to a wonderful stay. We had a renovated room and found everything to be in top notch condition. After a long day at the parks, it is so nice to come back to a location that is so calm and relaxing.
reviews.title: Liveliness

reviews.text: Down to earth if ve luv ourself we won't miss out such a great creativity
reviews.title: Expensive with incredible Value!

reviews.text: So pple don't miss out
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.text: Freak urself in tis world
reviews.title: PERFECT Resort for Restful Retreat!!

reviews.text: The Polynesian is my new favorite Disney hotel! Great atmosphere, large rooms, and good food options. The pool was very nice, and the kids loved the volcano slide, but it was not overly large. The beach was nice, and the movies at night were liked by my 9 and 5 year old kids.
reviews.title: Welcomed only by the biting insects
Great place for small kids!
reviews.text: We loved the Polynesian Resort at Disney World. The pictures don't do it justice. I am a very picky hotel patron and i was NOT dissappointed!! It was wonderful. We stayed for our 10 year anniversary and we were surprised with a complementary basket full of goodies congratulating us. Our 2 small kids ages 3 and 5 joined us. Our room was very clean and spacious. Our only complaint was that the shower head was positioned fairly low. My husband is 6' 3" and he had to bend down a bit to shower. It is a great location close to everthing with the monorail right in the hotel. The grounds are gorgeous. You will really feel like you're in Polynesia with all of the foilage and palm trees! We will definitely stay there again.

My family of four (kids 12 and 17) stayed at the Polynesian for six nights during our Walt Disney World vacation. I felt like I had stepped into Hawaii when we entered the hotel property. I had researched several WDW properties prior to making reservations and decided to splurge on the Polynesian since my husband and I had recently celebrated our 20th wedding anniversary and it was going to be my son's last "childhood" trip to WDW. We were not disappointed at all!!
reviews.title: Loved the Polynesian!!

reviews.text: Everything about the Polynesian looked even better than the pictures had depicted, the employees were friendly, the beaches and pool area were awesome ... I could go on and on! I had requested a garden view room in the Tahiti bldg. because we needed two sinks and a larger room to accommodate our older children. They honored our request and allowed us to check in over 2 hours earlier than the usual check-in time. The room was beautiful and the bathroom (which others had called cramped) was quite large (because of the double sinks).
reviews.title: Best resort there is to stay at Disney

reviews.text: My only disappointment was that I failed to make reservations for the Spirit of Aloha dinner show and nothing was available while we were there. I also didn't make reservations for the Ohana restaurant and the wait was too long to get in. However, my husband and I enjoyed two wonderful meals at Kona Cafe (while my picky eater kids ate at Captain Cook's Snack Bar then went to the arcade next door).
reviews.title: Great for families going to Magic Kingdom

reviews.text: The Polynesian made our WDW vacation fantastic!!
reviews.title: Hawaiian paradise in Florida!

likes.liked: — Convenience of checking bags at hotel instead of airport

reviews.text: This was our family's second visit to the Poly and 5th visit to deluxe disney properties- we first started out at the Epcot properties and were spoiled by the concierge service at the Boardwalk. We switched to Poly because of the excellent proximity to Magic Kingdom and Epcot. If you spend a lot of time at these parks, the Polynesian is the place to be.
reviews.title: Service wasn't the same, grand gathering not so grand

likes.disliked: — service was not deluxe for a deluxe accomodation

reviews.text: The good points: Location Location Location! We had a nice room in the Hawaii building, and this year we had adjoining rooms with other family members who were traveling with us. The concierge food service was great! The kids liked the menu and it was convenient for us all. 4th of July fireworks can't be beat! The fireworks are for the Polynesian! It would be worth booking a lagoon-view room for the 4th! The pool is nice and the kids love the beach too!
reviews.title: Nice Place - Overpriced

reviews.text: The bad points: I hate to put this here because we do love the Poly, but the attention to detail this year was not at the same level as last year. First, they did not check us in at concierge, they sent us all in to the main lobby to check in. We were a grand gathering and were not pulled aside and told what our privs were as a grand gathering. I found out a day before we left that we were entitled to special seating at parades and shows. I found this out on a Disney bus from another family that were not informed of their grand gathering privs as well. We were also never called before arriving to book services or make reservations. I booked things on my own because, as a frequent Disney guest, I knew that I would not get good spa appointments or Cinderella's Castle if we didn't book early. I even explained this to the reservationists when I booked, and they did nothing to remedy the situation. Even thought I booked through the grand gathering reservationists, my spa appointments were not on our intinerary. I think the layout of the concierge area, with the concierge people on the first floor and seating on the second and third floors, makes it hard to interact with the staff. Other nits included light bulbs out in our bathroom and outside our hotel room door that were not replaced.
reviews.title: Be aware of bugs!

reviews.text: Stayed at the Polynesian for 5 nights in the concierge level room.
reviews.title: Money well spent, great location, speedy transports, clean!!!

reviews.text: The service was great, but the rooms are very dark. You can hardly see to put on eye makeup. The concierge level room was probably not worth the extra expense as the snacks are only nuts, popcorn and cookies. Breakfast consists of yogurt, bagels, cereal, fruit, juice and coffee. I was a little frustrated with paying for the concierge level room and not being able to get a soda at the pool bar for free. I had to walk back into the hotel to the lounge to retrieve a canned soda that were supplied for free. This didn't make any sense to me?! We visted all the Disney Parks. Transportation to the parks from the Polynesian was great!
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: This was not our first trip to Disney World and we usually stay at a moderate hotel but opted to upgrade this time to a deluxe and chose the Polynesian. Just after booking, I received a letter in the mail informing me that there would be construction on Sunset Beach during our stay, and I thought it excellent to give a heads up on that.
reviews.title: Great Disney Experience

reviews.text: We booked a lagoon view room and had an excellent view of the Castle & Space Mountain. We sat out on the balcony one night and enjoyed a perfect view of the fireworks. Our building was Tahiti, which is a bit of a haul from the Great Ceremonial House but an easy walk to the Ticket & Transportation Center, giving you more options on getting to the parks. We did really enjoy the fact that it was a 5 minute monorail ride to the Magic Kingdom and 10 minutes to Epcot. Staff was excellent and it appeared that our room was recently refurbished. Also, the room was somewhat larger than other rooms we've stayed at in other Disney resorts. We had 2 double beds and the couch also folded out into a bed, so this would be a good option for larger families.
reviews.title: Very nice, but...

reviews.text: Captain Cook's is great to grab a quick bite, although the seating area is a bit small and it can be hard to find a table. Both Kona Cafe and O'Hana's are top notch.
reviews.title: Definietly a Premium Experience

reviews.text: Again, we stayed in Tahiti and the entirety of the beach just outside our room was under refurbishment. We were on the 2nd floor so it was not an issue with the view but if you're on the 1st floor it would definitely be a problem.
reviews.title: Good fun and great for kids!
First class
reviews.text: We would definitely stay here again, while its pricey the location does make up for it.

We (husband, 2 boys, and myself) have stayed at quite a few of the Disney hotels and found this one to be our favorite as far as theme, but we did not feel the overall service was worth the high price. We had a ground floor room in the Samoa building and faced the volcano pool. The landscaping is very lush and beautiful and the atmosphere truly immerses you in the tropics. The pool, while not huge, was not overly crowded. My boys loved the waterslide and the zero entry pool was great for families with small children. Our room was a great size for our family and the proximity to the MK and Epcot can't be beat. Breakfast at Kona Cafe was very good (Tonga Toast is a favorite) if not a little pricey, but hey, Disney prices are never cheap.
reviews.title: Good, but with issues

likes.liked: — Size of the rooms, proximity to the parks
likes.disliked: — spotty cleaning and no hot water

reviews.text: Our room, while clean for the most part, had a beach towel (from a previous guest)hanging out the back of the daybed. The water pressure fluctuated constantly and rarely did I have a hot shower. There was a sulfur odor from the water and the air conditioners are louder than I've ever heard at a hotel. Some people might feel that this is nitpicking, but you are not paying $100/night for a room here...
reviews.title: Best Choice at Disney

likes.liked: — overall feel of the resort and the big spacious rooms

reviews.text: I really want to love this hotel, but for the price, I think that Disney needs to address some maintenance issues.
reviews.title: Great location and atmosphere, but housekeeping issues...

likes.liked: — Close to Magic Kingdom, beautiful setting
likes.disliked: — Spotty housekeeping and snippy response from manager

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I and our 2 children (9 and 5) stayed at the Polynesian for 1 week the beginning of May. We originally wanted the Beach Club but since it was sold out we chose the Poly. We are really glad we did. We stayed in the Tokelau building in a garden view room overlooking the quiet pool. The rooms were beautifully done and enormous. The largest standard room I have ever stayed in, I would even classify the rooms as mini suites since they had a sofa and 2 chairs in a large sitting area. The beds were really comfortable and large as well (queens). The flat screen HDtv was nice but don't expect tons of channels. You recieve the networks, soapnet, discovery and of course the disney channel but a lot of the channels were devoted to showing you all the things there is to see and do at Disney. The only problem with our room was the showerhead, it wasn't the best. It was ok just could be better. Also with our room if you are on the balcony and look to the right you have a perfect view of cinderellas castle. Nice.
reviews.title: Heaven in Disney

reviews.text: The resort itself was beautiful. Nice and lush. Starting with the lobby and its incredible waterfall and tropical plants. The volcano pool is very nice and it is open late which we liked. We were still there swimming after 9:30pm and there were others there as well. The pool bar closes at 9pm I believe. It is nice to watch the fireworks from the volcano pool and they have a boat parade every evening which we really liked. The resort was really convienent being on the monorail. You can jump on the monorail and be at MK in a couple of minutes but we actually perferred the boat. It was a nice ride over the water to MK. It took a little longer but was nice and relaxing before starting a hectic day at the parks. It was also a quick walk (5min) over to the ticket and transportation center, from there you could jump on the monorail to go to Epcot or take the buses to MGM or AK. There are also buses that leave straight from the Poly to MGM and AK as well. The only complaint would be the noise in the lobby in the evening very loud. They have singers and entertainers but during our dinner at the Kona cafe it was really distracting. I did not like the Kona cafe I felt like I was sitting eating dinner in the middle of the lobby, the food was disappointing and like I said the lobby noise made it loud. O' hanas was good though and the lobby noise didn't seem to reach us in there.
reviews.title: The best resort at Disney!

reviews.text: Quite expensive (~$500/night), this hotel is located on the monorail route, so if location is your priority, this is a good choice. Our room (in the Tahiti building) was run down and in desperate need of updating. There are no 'perks' to the room. We found the rooms to be sub-standard with poor lighting, mold in the bathrooms, and dingy bedcovers. The hallways were worse.
reviews.title: You pay for the location, not the amenities

reviews.text: We spent as little time as possible in the room.
reviews.title: A little dated, but excellent service

reviews.text: If you stay here, you will pay for the location/proximity to the Magic Kingdom. The Polynesian has a monorail stop in its lobby which makes it very convenient to get to the park. Other than that, this hotel is not worth the cost.
reviews.title: Best Location!!!

reviews.text: The Polynesian is a little dated, but I think that its retro feel is part of its charm. The room was nice and definitely big enough to accommodate my family of 5. You can't beat the location (on the monorail with boat access to Magic Kingdom). There are several pools- with water slides at one pool. Nice place to get a quick bit to eat in the morning before you hit the parks and a great all-you-can-eat Hawaiian restaurant as well (need reservations). There is a character breakfast here as well- the food is average but the kids love meeting the characters. When we come back to WDW, we'll likely stay here.
reviews.title: Great location, room ok, water awful.

reviews.text: Great Hotel!
reviews.title: A fantastic resort.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Found the Polynesian Resort through the Tikiman Steve website and used their recommended travel agent. A wonderful stay here; very clean rooms, very nice staff, and the restaurants were even good. We liked the Kona Cafe and Ohana's restaurants. The transportation to Magic Kingdom is very good because you can take the monorail over, and you are also close to the transportation center for buses and other monorail service. Our room appeared to be newly refurbished which was nice. Did not do the dinner luau here but didn't hear great reviews about it anyway. Would definitely recommend this resort to others - its a little pricey, but I think a good value for what you spend.
reviews.title: Peaceful & Relaxing, Great Location

reviews.text: We just returned from a 7 night stay at the Polynesian Resort. We travelled with my parents, my brother and his family and my family of four. Here are my thoughts:
reviews.title: Loved the Poly Hawaii Concierge!!

reviews.text: We have stayed here several times in the past, dating back to the 70's when I was a child....enough said:) We have enjoyed the concierge service and lounge in the Hawaii building in the past and decided to book it, once again. Our TA booked our 3 rooms in the Hawaii building (best location IMHO) on the garden view side. We really wanted the Magic Kingdom view, but at an additional $125, we declined. Well, this must be the Year of a Million Dreams, because all of us were upgraded to the MK view!!
reviews.title: Lovely and good for kids

likes.liked: — Atmosphere and grounds, location, rooms, beds

reviews.text: It was my Dad's 75th Bday, and it was amazing!
reviews.title: Love it-Can't afford it anymore

likes.liked: — the way it displays the entire Disney experience

reviews.text: The club lounge offers a wonderful assortment of breakfast pastires, fruits, bagles, cereals. Lemonade, cookies, treats, soft drinks are available throughout the day. A nice touch when weary families return from the parks! Evening appetizers could easily be a simple meal for a family not wishing to run to a dining reservation every evening.The staff in the lounge is A+++.. They will go the distance for any request. Thank you Chef Dick and staff for making our stay so enjoyable.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay but just to expensive

likes.liked: — Proximity and transportation options to Magic Kingdom
likes.disliked: — Had to switch rooms becuase of sewage problem but was upgraded to lagoon view.

description: Disney's Polynesian Resort is a relaxing tropical paradise, featuring lush vegetation, thatched roofs, koi ponds and white-sand lakebeaches and offering a warm, welcoming world that celebrates the spirit of the South Pacific and ensures "Ho'Onanea"—the passing of time in languid tranquility.
